thread.title: Thursday's local sports roundup: football, soccer, softball
thread.title_full: Thursday's local sports roundup: football, soccer, softball

author: Staff reports
title: Thursday's local sports roundup: football, soccer, softball
text: Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 11:42 PM Updated at 11:44 PM Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 11:42 PM Updated at 11:44 PM College football GWU set to host another ranked foe — Gardner-Webb tries to bounce back after a disappointing Big South Conference football defeat in the final seconds at Kennesaw State last week. To do that, the Runnin’ Bulldogs will have to handle 20th-ranked Charleston Southern Saturday in a 2 p.m. showdown at Spangler Stadium. The Buccaneers enter with a 5-1 record (2-0 league) while GWU stands at 2-4 (1-1 Big South). Also on tap Saturday in league play: Top-ranked Coastal Carolina (6-0, 1-0 league) visits league newcomer Monmouth (3-4, 1-1) at 1 p.m. Monmouth upset Liberty in overtime last week. The other first-year Big South program, Kennesaw State (5-1, 1-1), plays at Liberty (3-4, 0-2) in a 7 p.m. matchup. JV football Crest 55, East Rutherford 7 — The junior Chargers rolled to a 40-7 halftime lead Thursday night at Sid Bryson Stadium and coasted to a victory. Austin Jones fired scoring passes of 55 yards to Ty Housh and 50 yards to Denorray Surratt. Jones also threw two 2-point conversion passes to Tyler Nelson and Brayson Melton, respectively. Housh was also on the receiving end of a 40-yard scoring toss from Jolly Jeter. O.D. Ross had a 40-yard touchdown run and also returned a kickoff for a Crest score. Davian Pryor had a 4-yard touchdown run and also a conversion run. Caleb McEntyre returned an interception 30 yards for another Charger score. Raekwon Young Turner ran for a pair of 2-point conversions, and Logan Costner kicked one extra point for the victors. Kings Mountain 38, Chase 0 — The Junior Mounties remained unbeaten in conference play with the win. Kaylon Wade ran for two touchdowns and also threw for scores to Tyler Osborne and Holden Turner. Chuckie Osborne threw a touchdown pass to Seth Bishop. Christopher Brittain had a rushing score. Landry Crawford had a 2-point conversion reception. Defensive standouts included Landon Zanders (interception), A.J. Austin and James Parson (fumble recoveries). College wrestling GWU wrestlers picked fourth — Gardner-Webb wrestlers were voted fourth in the 2015 Southern Conference Coaches Poll announced Thursday. Coach Daniel Elliott’s squad had a 4-3 record against SoCon foes last season and returns seven competitors who posted winning records. GWU finished behind The Citadel, Appalachian State and Chattanooga in the poll. Top Runnin’ Bulldog returnees include Hunter Gamble (184 pounds), Ryan Mosley (149), Austin Trott (165), plus Cortez Starkes (125), Tyler Ziegler (133 pounds), Chris Vassar (141), Kyle Ash (157), Cristian Maroni (174), Brett Stein (174), Gray Jones (197) and Boyce Cornwell (285). GWU opens the season in Boone on Nov. 7, battling Cal State Bakersfield and Anderson (S.C.) University. Women’s college soccer GWU 1, Presbyterian 1 — Samuelle Grove’s goal in the 50th minute lifted the Gardner-Webb women’s soccer team to a 1-1 draw against Presbyterian in a Big South Conference match. With the draw, the Runnin’ Bulldogs moved to 5-8-4 overall and 2-4-2 in Big South play. GWU now sits eighth in the Big South standings, the last spot receiving a bid to the conference tournament. Page 2 of 2 - Offensively, GWU outshot the Blue Hose 22-13. Tara Woelfel and Shelby Hooe led the charge for GWU, recording a game-high five shots apiece. Keely Brown got the start in net for GWU and recorded six saves. Varsity soccer Kings Mountain 6, East Rutherford 0 (Wednesday) — The Mountaineers roared to a 3-0 lead on senior night and went on to claim a SMAC win. Weston Harmon, Jordan Sweezy and Josia Schneider each produced two goals for the victors. Justin Queen, Nolan Raby, Brandon Quevedo-Johns and Luke Rikard provided assists. Jarrett Ledford and John Harris split time in goal as Kings Mountain notched its 10th shutout of the season. Middle school soccer East Lincoln 4, Kings Mountain 1 — The Patriots completed a 4-6 season with Tristan Stenger scoring on a penalty kick for the only KMMS goal. Crest 3, East Rutherford 2 — Blake Alexander had a goal and an assist to lead the victors. David Vences and Frank Kennedy also scored, while Thadeus Talbert and Jadin Merritt supplied assists. Middle school softball Crest 8, East Rutherford 3 — Sydney Kale was the winning pitcher, allowing three hits and striking out 12 in a complete-game effort. Kale also led the Dragons at the plate with three hits, including a triple and a double. Summer Deaton hit a two-run home run. Abby Ramsey had a three-run triple and a double. Laney Jo Patterson and Sierra Crocker had two hits apiece. Crest finished the regular season 12-1 (9-1 conference), earning a No. 2 seed in the playoffs. The Dragons host West Lincoln on Tuesday in the first round. Shelby 8, R-S Central 4 — Brooklin Heavner earned the mound win and delivered two hits to lead the Blue Devils to a season-ending victory. By Staff reports
